intro: Polyxena paucifolia, commonly known as the sparse-leaved polyxena, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Its foliage is sparse, with narrow, linear leaves that reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a clustered inflorescence, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
